td.div: Department

tr.td: LiveBinders has general information for 9-12, then also by grade level. When you click on a tab, if it doesn't immediately go to the website, click on Go To Site.
The Ben C. Eade Scholarship Deadline has been extended to April 30th. Please EMAIL your completed application to your school counselor.
I post general information for all grade levels that I think will be helpful, if you forgot to join, please email me for the classroom code.
I am working on making Google Classroom my central "hub" for posting information. If you haven't joined yet, the code is isyqnpe. Please email me if you would like an invite to join.

Community Resources: The link provides resource contacts for students that may be struggling with drugs/alcohol, depression, domestic abuse, and other emotional issues. The contacts take a variety of insurances and some work on sliding pay scales.
This is an extensive list of community agencies that can help with just about anything from counseling services to access to food
Golden Apple Scholarship: for students that want to become a teacher. The application due date is Sunday, April 12th.
Copy and paste this link for a pdf of general Golden Apple Scholarship information. Contact your School Counselor for assistance.
Elmberg Student Loan program for Students attending U of I Urbana- Champaign in the fall

Alf M. Diesz Scholarship, The purpose of the award is to help the applicant continue his/her education in the major field of Police Science or Law Enforcement in a recognized two- or four-year accredited college. Please click on the link for eligibility info
Ms. Martin's favorite app. Like it says, it helps keep me Calm; whether its soothing noises or controlling my breathing, available for both Apple and Android, and the basic account is free.
XELLO, continue working on the 4 basic lessons. We started with the Career Matchmaker, complete the Personality quiz, Learning Styles quiz, and Mission Complete.
For emergency support after hours/on weekends, please contact one of the emergency options below, or call 911.
Sometimes when we have no control over what's happening we need to reach out and talk to someone. Please use these numbers if you or your student is in crisis.
Linden Oaks Behavioral Health: 630-305-5027, National Suicide Prevention Hotline: 1-800-273-8255, Crisis Text Line: Text START to 741-741
Sometimes when we have no control over what's happening we need to reach out and talk to someone. Please use these numbers if you or your student is in crisis.

This is the link to the online reading program Mrs. Cervantes, Mrs. Trupiano, and Mrs. Garcia use. Your child should know his or her log-in. You will need to help your student with the program, as there are portions where a teacher/ adult need to be present to pass students. If you wish you use this program while school is closed, please contact Kristie Cervantes: kcervantes@sandwich430.org to set up a parent account and for directions on how to help your student with this.
